Bells, Us and Practices

The Ringers
We have a fairly big band, occasionally reaching 18-20 on a practice night, although 10-12 is more likely. We have a number of learner ringers, from those learning handling and called changes to those learning hunting to methods. We now regularly have a band to ring touches of triples, including Stedman. We have also started to ring Surprise methods.

The ringers are mostly locally trained, by our exceptional tower captain - although there are still a number of ringers who have been poached from other nearby towers. :-)

We can usually ring 8 on a Sunday and for times when the church requires ringing.

Where possible, ALL our ringers get selected to ring for 'events' - Sundays, weddings, 1/4s etc... - that's everyone from the real beginner to the more established.



The Bells


The specifics of the bells at Battle are as follows:

BellWeight(cwt-qtr-lbs)NoteYearFounder
15-2-5E flat1867Mears and Stainbank
26-0-24D1815 
36-1-18C1874 
47-2-18B flat1803 
59-1-17A flat1803 
610-3-18G1869 
714-2-0F1890John Waner and Sons, London
821-3-8E flat1825Thomas Mears
 
 79-1-24
(4,037kg)		   

All bells were rehung in 1962 by Whitechapel bell foundry.

NOTE:
1cwt (hundredweight) = 112 lbs (pounds) = 4 qtr (quarters) = 50.8kg.
1qtr = 28 lbs = 12.7kg.
20cwt = 1ton = 1000kg.
1 imperial ton = 1 metric tonne(approximately).



Ringing Times
Practice night
Tuesday, from 7:30pm - 9:30pm. Followed by an evening at 'The Chequers' (a 1 minute walk from the tower).

Sundays
10:30am - 11:00am, except 5th Sunday, which is 9:30am - 10:00am.

Other
Visitors to practice nights are always very welcome and appreciated.
Quarter peals are usually rung Sunday afternoons for evensong, by arrangement only.
Visiting bands are welcome. Please contact our Secretary, Simon Lawrence on 07801 855349. Or email us at battle@jofaircloth.co.uk.
